00177 
00191 int NutNetIfSetup(NUTDEVICE * dev, uint32_t ip_addr, uint32_t ip_mask, uint32_t gateway)
00192 {
00193     IFNET *nif;
00194 
00195     nif = dev->dev_icb;
00196 
00197     /*
00198      * Use specified or previously used IP address.
00199      */
00200     if (ip_addr == 0 && (ip_addr = confnet.cdn_ip_addr) == 0)
00201         return -1;
00202     nif->if_local_ip = ip_addr;
00203 
00204     /*
00205      * Use specified or default mask.
00206      */
00207     if (ip_mask == 0)
00208         ip_mask = inet_addr("255.255.255.0");
00209     nif->if_mask = ip_mask;
00210 
00211     /*
00212      * Add routing entries.
00213      */
00214     NutIpRouteAdd(ip_addr & ip_mask, ip_mask, 0, dev);
00215     if (gateway)
00216         NutIpRouteAdd(0, 0, gateway, dev);
00217 
00218     /*
00219      * Save configuration in EEPROM.
00220      */
00221     memcpy(confnet.cd_name, dev->dev_name, sizeof(confnet.cd_name));
00222     /* Never save an invalid MAC address. */
00223     if (ETHER_IS_UNICAST(nif->if_mac)) {
00224         memcpy(confnet.cdn_mac, nif->if_mac, sizeof(nif->if_mac));
00225     }
00226     confnet.cdn_ip_addr = ip_addr;
00227     confnet.cdn_ip_mask = ip_mask;
00228 
00229     /*
00230      * Set gateway, if one was provided by the caller. Remove
00231      * gateway, if it's outside of our network.
00232      */
00233     if (gateway || (confnet.cdn_gateway & ip_mask) != (ip_addr & ip_mask))
00234         confnet.cdn_gateway = gateway;
00235 
00236     return NutNetSaveConfig();
00237 }
00238 
00274 int NutNetIfConfig(CONST char *name, void *params, uint32_t ip_addr, uint32_t ip_mask)
00275 {
00276     return NutNetIfConfig2(name, params, ip_addr, ip_mask, 0);
00277 }
00278 
00309 int NutNetIfConfig2(CONST char *name, void *params, uint32_t ip_addr, uint32_t ip_mask, uint32_t gateway)
00310 {
00311     NUTDEVICE *dev;
00312     IFNET *nif;
00313 
00314     /*
00315      * Check if this is a registered network device.
00316      */
00317     if ((dev = NutDeviceLookup(name)) == 0 || dev->dev_type != IFTYP_NET)
00318         return -1;
00319 
00320     /*
00321      * Setup Ethernet interfaces.
00322      */
00323     nif = dev->dev_icb;
00324     if (nif->if_type == IFT_ETHER) {
00325         /* Check if ioctl is supported. */
00326         if (dev->dev_ioctl) {
00327             uint32_t flags;
00328 
00329             /* Driver has ioctl, use it. */
00330             dev->dev_ioctl(dev, SIOCGIFFLAGS, &flags);
00331             dev->dev_ioctl(dev, SIOCSIFADDR, params);
00332             flags |= IFF_UP;
00333             dev->dev_ioctl(dev, SIOCSIFFLAGS, &flags);
00334         } else {
00335             /* No ioctl, set MAC address to start driver. */
00336             memcpy(nif->if_mac, params, sizeof(nif->if_mac));
00337         }
00338         return NutNetIfSetup(dev, ip_addr, ip_mask, gateway);
00339     }
00340 
00341     /*
00342      * Setup PPP interfaces.
00343      */
00344     else if (nif->if_type == IFT_PPP) {
00345         PPPDCB *dcb = dev->dev_dcb;
00346 
00347         /*
00348          * Set the interface's IP address, make sure that the state
00349          * change queue is empty and switch hardware driver into 
00350          * network mode.
00351          */
00352         dcb->dcb_local_ip = ip_addr;
00353         dcb->dcb_ip_mask = ip_mask ? ip_mask : 0xffffffff;
00354         NutEventBroadcast(&dcb->dcb_state_chg);
00355         _ioctl(dcb->dcb_fd, HDLC_SETIFNET, &dev);
00356 
00357         /*
00358          * Wait for network layer up and configure the interface on
00359          * success.
00360          */
00361         if (NutEventWait(&dcb->dcb_state_chg, 60000) == 0 && dcb->dcb_ipcp_state == PPPS_OPENED) {
00362             return NutNetIfSetup(dev, dcb->dcb_local_ip, dcb->dcb_ip_mask, dcb->dcb_remote_ip);
00363         }
00364     }
00365     return -1;
00366 }
